text: What is the reason you from an h1 to an h3? That kind of takes the hierarchy of the content out of it. I'd guess that your h3 was styled a certain way and that was just easier.
For those who have built mega menus using HS, did you use the native menu for HS to do it or was it a custom module build?
We have a client wanting a mega menu with images and things in the dropdown but i know its not a default HS thing
I've done it both ways, way easier to do with a custom module. I think <@U25PYL3Q8> did one with the HubSpot advanced menu?
<@U2H1Q3F8R> when your users need to update the menu items (when using custom) do they go into your coded module to do so? (i am assuming yes)
Hey AJ here’s a mega menu we built for a client, it’s 1 solid menu in HS <https://www.staywell.com/>
Yeah, provided documentation to how to edit it.
there is some css and js wizardry going on. I didn’t personally build the full thing out my coworker did the hard parts.
<@U7SL518D6> i am not seeing a mega menu on this site
click one of the links
where is the mega menu?
you’ll see
ahhhh
:thumbsup:
one of the more ridiculous mega menus I’ve ever been apart of. We didn’t dictate the UX/UI, client had someone internally dictate that
Thats pretty sweet!
OT: really cool site <@U7SL518D6> I like the design of it a lot.
Does anyone from HS know if they have any plans to redo the menuing system so we can have more control to do thing like mega menus without having to use a ton of JS to make it happen?
we worked our butts off on it. So I hope people like it. Not my favorite design, but it came out well.

I’m in support of a way to do it.

Though personally I have no idea how they would build such a thing. Everyone wants their mega-menus to look/ function different.

Take the staywell site I linked for example - they are one of the few companies that would want the top level items to go into a drop down with the rest mega menu style etc.

Plus if HS does it I would ask that they try to follow Accessibility best practices(accessibility in mega menus is mind-bogglingly difficult)

I personally have never built 2 matching mega menu designs.

Agreed, the only way to do it would be to allow us to build a "Menu Settings Page" where we could control the output of the menu itself. Even giving soemthing similar to the blog loop where it was a menu loop so you could output things. Then simply having a "menu config" that operate like the module preview could work... maybe lol
I see a whole DM2 style custom module interface for menus coming about
`{%- for menu_link in mega_super_duper_menu -%}`

Yea that would be the best option. Simply having a "Menu Manager" Design System. The issue comes in where you need to be able to have access to edit the menu editing interface (much like you can modify the WP Admin area) so you can do some kind of custom config like "Add menu item" Then have a check next to it for "Include Image?" and so on
<@U2H3TT8F2> <http://square2marketing.com|square2marketing.com>
The services dropdown
<@U25PYL3Q8> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/F9KM7BCLQ/my_menu_insert.txt|My menu insert>
<@U25PYL3Q8> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/F9L859K0T/the_script_to_bring_the_mega_menu_into_the_main_menu.js|the script to bring the mega menu into the main menu>
I capture the menu html into a variable. I remove the hidden one that contained the original menu hubl call.
Then I have some other scripting in there to split the menus into two sections and append and some other stuff for visuals
You can probably get rid of a bunch of that script and make it work for you
this makes sense and is the same way i was thinking for stuff like this. Thanks <@U25PYL3Q8>
Thanks! I wouldn't have seen this so I'm glad you tagged me so I could lend a hand
If you have any problems hit me up
will do
